captions.text: Michi: Come on, man! Take away your hand!
Danie: What? Which hand?
Hi and welcome to a new video!
Today, we will review a quite unknown boot
from a brand called DR3.
We will let you know how it performs during our test.
If you watch the video till the end
you also have the chance to win the boot.
Enjoy the video!
The comfort of the DR3 was quite good.
I didn't have any pressure marks or blisters.
The fit was a little bit too stiff at the backheel.
Also, the forefoot was a little bit too wide for my feet.
This means a small points deduction.
The thin upper should offer a good feel for the ball.
However, we had problems because of the wide fit
which impairs the touch and feel for the ball.
So, we have to deduct a few points again.
The quality and durability of the DR3 is really good.
Especially, regarding the low price of 30 euros
the quality and durability is really excellent.
I think the boot is quite good and recommendable
for its price category.
The forefoot was a bit too wide
the backheel was a bit too hard.
Still, the fit was okay.
I didn't have any blisters or pressure marks.
The sole offers a good grip on artificial grass.
I rate the boot with 7 out of 10 points.
I think you receive a really good product for 30€.
Of course, the boot still has its weak points
which is unavoidable in this price category.
It's quite heavy - which wasn't the main problem for me.
Further, it's too wide.
I didn't have a snug and slim fit.
This is why I didn't have the best touch in this boot.
Still, we have to point out the quality and durability.
It's really good for 30€!
So, if you have the chance, I suggest you to test it out
and see if it fits your foot.
You can't do anything wrong for 30€!
Yeah, I agree with Danie and Michi.
You get a quality boot for a low price.
In this price category you can only
compare the DR3 to discounter boots.
In the past, I have tested a boot
from Deichmann (German shoe discounter)
and I think the DR3 is far ahead.
Well, there are problems about the fit.
Thus, the feel for the ball isn't as good as
with a Vapor or F50 - as Danie mentioned before.
However, the quality and the sole are quite good.
You can play on artificial grass as well as on hard court.
So, I also rate the boot with 7 out of 10 points.
Let's now come to the giveaway!
The rules are pretty simple...
Rate the video.
Let us know in the comments below...
What do you like most about the DR3?
To increase your chance to win
you can post a photo of yourself on Instagram
showing what a good football player is about.
Also, tag the Instagram account @dr3sports
so we can find the photos.
Thank you for watching!
Stay sporty and see you in the next video!

comments.text:
What I like about the DR3 Tempest is that it is a quality boot that is 
cheap. Good cleats do not need to be $100-$300. Also the features i like 
most are the wide feet and the material. Personally i have wide feet that 
most boots don't fit so it's nice to know that there is a boot out there 
that thinks about wide footed players.  Also the material seems like a very 
good, sturdy, durable material that is good for the sport.  I think that 
this is an amazing boot that people should consider for the fact that the 
boot is a very durable boot that isn't very expensive.﻿

comments.author: Jacob Gadberry

comments.text:
Being a good footballer is about loving the game for what it is and not the 
equipment you have. You see kids in third world countries play with a non 
pumped no named ball and the smiles on their faces are brighter than the 
sun. This sport can be play by anyone and that's how all sports should be 
played. As for the boot, I'm hoping to win because I have wide feet and as 
you can imagine in a game...It can end up hurting your feet with the wrong 
cleat on...I also like the fact that this isn't a high name brand and it 
would be interesting to test the "lower" brand compared to the higher brand 
of cleats. The pricing is also very good so I would love to get these and 
see if they hold up to their name. Thank you (Wish I could post to 
instagram but I can't) I'd rate the video a 8/10, Only because I would like 
to know abit more on how wide and stiff you mean? Stiff as in not 
recommended or what?  Other than that this video was amazing and usually.﻿

issues in newer models like the hard sole and width of it so it is more 
comfortable for people with narrower feet. Other then that great affordable 
boot's :) (10/10 on the video)﻿
